abstract: By combining social networking and online video, Blinkx hopes to better compete with YouTube, the market-leading video-sharing service owned by Google.
snippet: By combining social networking and online video, Blinkx hopes to better compete with YouTube, the market-leading video-sharing service owned by Google.
lead_paragraph: Blinkx, an Internet video search company based in London, will allow consumers to make money from the videos they show on their own blogs, social network sites or home pages if they agree to embed advertising in the videos.

headline.main: Internet Company to Let Consumers Profit From Posted Videos
headline.print_headline: Internet Company to Let Consumers Profit From Posted Videos

abstract: Google said Tuesday that it had bought a Finnish start-up Jaiku, which makes a mobile phone application people can use to send short messages about where they are and what they are doing.
lead_paragraph: Google said Tuesday that it had bought a Finnish start-up Jaiku, which makes a mobile phone application people can use to send short messages about where they are and what they are doing.

abstract: Consumers spent $60 million in the second quarter to use navigation features built into their cellphones. Google could offer this feature free.
snippet: Consumers spent $60 million in the second quarter to use navigation features built into their cellphones. Google could offer this feature free.
lead_paragraph: Google has a penchant for taking services that had been paid and offering them free, often supported by advertising. So as the company moves to enter the cellphone software business, there is a natural question of whether it will be able to subsidize the cost of wireless service.

headline.main: One Reason We Need a Google Phone: Free GPS
